content: Act as a helpful AI assistant

In Julia, Given a DataFrame `df` with column `dt` representing DateTimes. Write a function `add_yearmonth` that creates a new column `ym` by extracting year and month from `dt` and concatenating them together as an integer in format: “yyyymm”.

Here is the solution to your request, using the DataFrames package for handling DataFrames.

```julia
using DataFrames

function add_yearmonth(df::DataFrame)
    df[:ym] = map(d -> Dates.year(d)*100 + Dates.month(d), df.dt)
    return df
end
```
You can use the function like this:

```julia
df = DataFrame(dt=[Date(2021, 1, 1); Date(2022, 2, 29); Date(2023, 3, 31)], other_column=["A", "B", "C"])
add_yearmonth(df)
```
This will create a new column `ym` in the DataFrame with values `202101`, `202202`, and `202303` respectively, derived from the year and month of each date.
